intro: Primula tsongpenii, commonly known as the Tsongpen primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
